paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant V122I, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The V122I variant is the most common amyloidogenic mutation worldwide, producing familial amyloidotic cardiomyopathy primarily in individuals of African descent.
The V122I variant is the most common amyloidogenic mutation worldwide, producing familial amyloidotic cardiomyopathy primarily in individuals of African descent.
The V122I variant is the most common amyloidogenic mutation worldwide, producing familial amyloidotic cardiomyopathy primarily in individuals of African descent.
The V122I variant is the most common amyloidogenic mutation worldwide, producing familial amyloidotic cardiomyopathy primarily in individuals of African descent.

functional_data.summary: The V122I variant increases the velocity of rate-limiting tetramer dissociation, resulting in accelerated amyloidosis.

variants.population_frequency: Common in individuals of African descent.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is associated with a significant risk of developing cardiomyopathy.
key_quotes: The V122I variant is the most common amyloidogenic mutation worldwide.
This mutation does not destabilize the tertiary structure or alter the rate of amyloidogenesis relative to the wild-type monomer.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from the main text.
